topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/535b67866368724069940000#post_535b67866368724069940000
[bq="twistedmetalero"]"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/535b6335636872771b2b0000#post_535b6335636872771b2b0000

Its for stupid reasons i want to fix it now

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/535b606b63687237ad510000#post_535b606b63687237ad510000

That doesnt really work, asus products dont show much related to my pc in their page, and googling y model with bios yields no results
[/bq]
*thud
There's a reason why I said it's going to be a pain in the ass to fix; the reason being is that without the model number on your tower you're going to have to not only visually search through every current asus model, but every single discontinued model as well.  We're talking hundreds of computers and potentially thousands.  If you knew what year it was made it would drastically help trying to find it, but since it's a refurbished computer you're absolutely shit out of luck.

The only option you have is to either spend hours visually looking through every model asus has ever made or take it to a computer repair store and tell them the bios is corrupted.  If you take it to a repair store ask him to tell you what model it is and *NEVER* forget what model it is; tattoo it on your hand if you need to cause this problem could be fixed literally in one minute if you had the model number.

Last time my bios got corrupted it took me five seconds to input the internet wifi password, 20 seconds to find the website, 5 seconds to download the bios files, 5 seconds to put it on a thumb drive, 30 seconds to follow the steps.

If I could help I would, but this is the equivalent of someone needing a new ignition coil for a car, but not having the car model or any information other about the car than it's a ford and having to visually look through thousands of ignition coils to see which one it is.

Hey I just thought of something, while I'm not sure if it belongs here or in another thread it's more of economics than the other thread; you know the people that never shut the hell up about "decline of morality"?  I realized how to partially shut them the hell up using economics.

If they're going around trying to act morally superior then bring up how in order for a country's economy to remain stable or grow a population has to either be stable or be growing, while there are tons more factors that go into this it is partially true in that if a country's population is shrinking cause no one is getting it on then that's going to screw up the economy, and how if they had their way they would completely wreck the country's economy.

It's only partially true, but at least it's enough to shut some people up.

topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/535c4882636872449eb90000#post_535c4882636872449eb90000
He's talking in terms he knows people won't understand so that if you ever have this problem again you'll come back and pay him to fix it again instead of learning how to fix this problem in the future.

In other words; look in your control panel, look at your model number and your information, write that stuff down and if you ever have this problem again you won't have to pay him to fix it and instead can just download a single program to your thumbdrive, press a couple buttons and it's fixed.  That's literally all he did was download a single file, put it to a thumbdrive, press the power button, a set of keys(normally alt F4) and done.  That's literally the steps to fixing this problem.
